CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Post-Transmission stage positioned above or below the Post-Distribution stage?
SRP.A: The Post-Transmission stage is positioned {above} the Post-Distribution stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Transmission?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Transmission is {53573}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Distribution?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Distribution is {33800}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Post-Generation, with a value of {87374}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Paid Consumption, with a value of {16435}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Post-Distribution to stage Delivered to End Users?
SC.A: Decreased by {14028} Megawatt Hours from stage Post-Distribution to stage Delivered to End Users.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 26786? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Post-Generation} stage has {87374}, the {Post-Transmission} stage has {53573}, the {Post-Distribution} stage has {33800}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 17468? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 19136 and 26786? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Delivered to End Users} stage has {19772}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Delivered to End Users to Billed Consumption, or from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to {Post-Transmission} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Post-Transmission to Post-Distribution, from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission, or from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Generation} to stage {Post-Transmission} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Generation} and {Post-Transmission} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Delivered to End Users} and {Billed Consumption} stages.
